snippet: Cetusa, a sponsor of a State Department work/travel program, was reviewed after 400 participants staged a walkout at a Hershey packing plant.
abstract: State Department bans prominent Council for Educational Travel, USA, from bringing foreign students to the United States for summer jobs; hopes to send message to dozens of private companies participating in the work program that they will have to monitor foreign students far more closely to ensure that they are not being exploited as cheap workers; move follows incident in which 400 foreign students walked out of abusive jobs they had been assigned to at a Hershey's plant.
lead_paragraph: Cetusa, a sponsor of a State Department work/travel program, was reviewed after 400 participants staged a walkout at a Hershey packing plant.

headline.seo: Company Banned by State Department in Effort to Protect Foreign Students
headline.main: Company Banned in Effort to Protect Foreign Students From Exploitation
headline.print_headline: Company Banned in Effort to Protect Foreign Students From Exploitation
